items.label: cor-between-group-dominance
items.title: Between-Group Variance Dominance
items.content:
355: :label: cor-between-group-dominance
356: 
357: For a high-error swarm satisfying $V_{\text{struct}} > R^2_{\text{spread}}$, the between-group variance term dominates:
358: 
359: $$
360: f_I f_J \|\mu_x(I_k) - \mu_x(J_k)\|^2 \geq c_{\text{sep}}(\varepsilon) V_{\text{struct}}
361: 
362: $$
363: 
364: for some N-uniform constant $c_{\text{sep}}(\varepsilon) > 0$.
365: 
366: **Proof:**
367: 
368: This follows from the Phase-Space Packing Lemma (Lemma 6.4.1 in [03_cloning](03_cloning), line 2409).
369: 
370: By the clustering construction (Definition 6.3, line 2351), the high-error set $H_k$ consists of outlier clusters with high between-cluster variance contribution. Since $I_k \subseteq H_k$ (target set is subset of high-error), the spatial separation between $I_k$ and $J_k$ (which contains all low-error walkers $L_k$) must be substantial.
371: 
372: Specifically, from the Phase-Space Packing Lemma with $d_{\text{close}} = D_{\text{diam}}(\varepsilon) = c_d \varepsilon$:
373: 
374: If $\text{Var}_h(S_k) > R^2_{\text{pack}} := \varepsilon^2 / 2$, then not all pairs can be close in phase space. This forces:
375: 
376: $$
377: \|\mu_x(I_k) - \mu_x(J_k)\|^2 \geq c_{\text{pack}}(\varepsilon) \text{Var}_x(S_k)
378: 
379: $$
380: 
381: for some geometric constant $c_{\text{pack}}(\varepsilon) > 0$.
382: 
383: Using $\text{Var}_x(S_k) \geq V_{\text{struct}} / (1 + \lambda_v)$ (position component of hypocoercive variance) and $f_I f_J \geq f_{UH} (1 - f_{UH}) \geq f_{UH}/2$ (for $f_{UH} \leq 1/2$):
384: 
385: $$
386: f_I f_J \|\mu_x(I_k) - \mu_x(J_k)\|^2 \geq \frac{f_{UH}}{2} \cdot c_{\text{pack}}(\varepsilon) \cdot \frac{V_{\text{struct}}}{1 + \lambda_v} =: c_{\text{sep}}(\varepsilon) V_{\text{struct}}
387: 
388: $$

items.label: cor-average-cloning
items.title: Average Cloning Pressure Bound
items.content:
838: :label: cor-average-cloning
839: 
840: The average cloning probability in the target set satisfies:
841: 
842: $$
843: \bar{p}_I = \frac{1}{|I_1|} \sum_{i \in I_1} p_{1,i} \geq p_u(\varepsilon)
844: 
845: $$
